intro: [WRONG START] Astellia raiateensis, commonly known as the Tahitian Astelia, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking clusters of white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical gardens. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
